com.djzass.medipoint.boundary_ui

Class AppointmentAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • android.widget.ArrayAdapter<Appointment>
        • com.djzass.medipoint.boundary_ui.AppointmentAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.Filterable, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter

    public class AppointmentAdapter
extends android.widget.ArrayAdapter<Appointment>
    Created by Deka on 30/3/2015. Appointment Adapter is a custom adapter class for displaying appointment item in the appointment list. This class extends from ArrayAdapter class and accepts Appointment objects. Each of the Appointment objects that use this adapter will be displayed as individual item in AppointmentListFragment.

    Each item in the appointment list will include:

    • Specialty Icon
    • Appointment Service
    • Appointment Status: Upcoming, Ongoing, Finished
    • Appointment Date
    • Appointment Time

    Since:
    2015
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Deka
    See Also:
    ArrayAdapter

      • getView

        public android.view.View getView(int position,
                                 android.view.View convertView,
                                 android.view.ViewGroup parent)
        Get a View that displays the data at the specified position in the data set.
        Specified by:
        getView in interface android.widget.Adapter
        Overrides:
        getView in class android.widget.ArrayAdapter<Appointment>
        Parameters:
        position - is the position of the item within the adapter's data set of items which view is requested
        convertView - for using the old view, if possible. The view is first checked, if this view is non-null and of an appropriate type before using. If it is not possible to convert this view to display the correct data, this method can be used to create a new view
        parent - the parent that this view will eventually be attached to
        Returns:
        View corresponding to the data at the specified position.
